title.narrative: CIJM Conflicts of Interests and Incompatibilities in Eastern Europe

description.narrative: The aim of this initiative is to provide the policy-makers experts in the field with insights from theformulation and implementation of policies preventing and sanctioning conflicts of interests andincompatibilities. In the project Center for Investigative Journalism (CIJM) looks at the practice onconflict of interests and incompatibilities in three countries that find themselves on different positions inthe relationship with the European Union ? Romania Croatia and Moldova. In the framework of thisparticul ar project the study on conflicts of interest will be conducted in the Republic of Moldova asExpert Forum will conduct the similar study in Croatia and Romania.CIJM will not only assess legislation but also the institutional framework that is put in place in thisfield and the results achieved so far. The analysis will identify the remaining challenges and willpropose policy solutions for all three countries. The report will be discussed with representatives of allthree countries at the end of the project du ring 2 conferences one to be held in Brussels (Belgium) andto be attended also by European experts) and one to be held in Chisinau (Moldova).For a better reasoning of the study starting from the state of things related to conflicts of interests andincompat ibilities in Moldova the CIJM team of journalists will produce a series of 9 journalisticinvestigations on conflict of interests integrity of the dignitaries and incompatibilities but also on thefunctioning of the Integrity Commission and other structures meant to implement the legislation onconflict of interests. The investigations will be published simultaneously in 10-15 publications webportals and TV stations of Moldova. CIJM journalists with journalists from various media will work onthe investigations . The production and publication of investigations aims at informing the citizens aboutconflicts of interest and officials? integrity so that citizens do not tolerate such cases but report themand put pressure on the governors to eliminate all the situatio ns of conflict of interest and others.
